line_1: And with them gaily deck'd his shining Grot:
line_2: All which she to her lov'd AVARO brought,

line_1: Div'd thro' the Gulphs, and search'd each darksome Grot;
line_2: The pensive God around the Waters 'sought,

line_1: On her lov'd Son, whom in a conscious Grot
line_2: Wand'ring from Troy the Grecian Chief begot,

line_1: And listening danc'd beneath their pearly grot:
line_2: My Naiads blythe the floating accents caught,

line_1: To seek the deep embosom'd grot,
line_2: Or wandering from the russet cot,

line_1: To swell the Terras, or to sink the Grot;
line_2: In all, let Nature never be forgot.

line_1: Sighs in the gale, and whispers round the grot;
line_2: While at sweet intervals each falling note

line_1: O haste thee from thy grave-like grot!
line_2: O mother of the fire-clad thought,

line_1: While I, within my peaceful grot,
How sweet, how charming will appear this Grot,
line_2: When by your art to full perfection brought!
